review:
Oh wow, where to begin. Let's start with the thing that I specially downloaded this game to get enough time to write about my experience with this game. I bought it on battlenet back in 2016 when it was awesome game. Early days of overwatch were great: game looked beautiful, was enjoyable, was fresh and balanced and it WAS fun. 

Blizzard's management ruined the game. They don't deliver, they only take your money.
There is no hope it will change. This game was released almost 3 years after it was announced, without the stuff they promised. It is not only unbalanced, poorly maintained game, but also jump on your money.

You will find only regret and anger in this game. Don't do that. Just don't feed blizzard. This is not first time they did that shit: look at D4 player drop, look what they did to wow, look what happened to starcraft 2. For the love of god, don't go into this game, it is not worth it.

Over a 1000 hours of gameplay on my Battlenet account. What Blizzard is doing to this game is borderline criminal. 
The hero changes and redesigns made it so there are little to no consequences to misplay, which also means there is no reward to outplaying your opponent or saving your teammate. 

Whenever a new hero comes out, you either pay the battle pass or you spend the whole season getting destroyed by the people who purchased it.

Skins that were previously earned through engaging and playing through fun seasonal events are now valued at more than some of the rarest CS GO skins. Features that worked fine on the OG game now partially work because... reasons (like the "on fire" system). 

And the cherry on top of the cake? They expect me to pay 15 euros for 1 hour and 30 minutes of watered down "story missions" that have no discernible budget differences from the missions we got on OW 1. 

So, let's recap:

The game is free now rather than the original's 39,99â‚¬ price point. BUT, for me to enjoy the same amount of content I had on OW 1 (missions, skins, heroes, etc) I need to spend probably triple that amount (if not more).

You're doing great Blizzard, keep it up.

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore

Happy to play this on steam

I put in way too many hours into OW1 (not like that matters as it was euthanised by Activision)
I played OW2 at launch
I play OW2 on Steam.

The same problems have been part of the core experience since its release in 2016. 

The game is very poorly designed visually. You are in a fight and you have no clue what is happenign cause there are 3 electric effects and 2 shields on you. Even on Max FoV its unplayable.

Character designs are nice but the game lacks depth. "Easy to play hard to master" actually means "We dont know how to design games and not like the suits are gonna give us training so we are just putting in the most straight forward and shallow thing we havnet put in yet.

Some heroes are just fucking useless. And you will really feel it with the 1 tank slot so there is no other tank to compensate for a griefer. 
People just run in to die so you are permanently done one character.

I dont even care about the shop being a scam. The game isnt worth playing even if I was paid.
